title: Frederick Ricketts
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. J. Willis Dalzell
provenance_text:
William Owen [1769-1825], London, England; presumably commissioned by the parents of the sitter, George Poyntz Ricketts, Governor of Barbadoes, 1794-1800, and Sophia Watts; by decent to his sister, Isabella Ricketts-Baston, wife of Stanlake Baston Esq. of Horseheath; Ricketts-Baston sale at Robinson, Fisher & Harding, London, England, November 19, 1925; Mrs. J. Willis Dalzell (Mary Beer Dalzell) [1844-1929], Pittsburgh, PA, until February 13, 1929; Mary B. Dalzell estate, February 1929; bequest to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1929.

Notes:
The painting was collected from Mrs. Dalzell's residence on Ridge Avenue in Pittsburgh and brought to Carnegie Institute on February 19, 1929. It was accessioned on February 25, 1929.

Under review by CGK
